page.title: 07Brackley Town Hall
page.content: Brackley Town Hall is a large rectangular building with two floors and a clock tower with a bell which rings every hour. It was built in 1705- 1707 by the Duke of Bridgwater and was constructed on arches which provided a covered market area. But in 1884 the lower part was enclosed and used as a corn exchange. In the Town Hall, the ground floor and the first floor have large halls which people can hire for plays, dances etc.. There is also an office for the Town Clerk on the first floor. To get to the loft, you climb up a spiral staircase. Then you can see the huge "queen" beams which support the roof. A final and very steep flight of stairs takes you to the little cabin behind the clock faces. Here you can hear the clock ticking and watch the mechanism.
